e9etpp3.Author: BCash_BeTrash
e9etpp3.Text:
My altcoin-loving shitcoin-gambling foolish friend, Lord Wankworth of Fuckton, tells me that it is now almost impossible to post or comment on the, allegedly censorship-free, r/ B T C.

Posting restrictions there, whilst they contentiously self-fork their own contentiously forked shitcoin, he tells me, are now so severe that almost all comments and postings are met with an auto-botty no-no message warning that accounts must mature by at least 6000 years for posts to be permitted.

'So much for lack of censorship', I said to him over supper last night.

'Fuck off' he replied, as he fondled Nursey in an ungentlemanly manner.

Lord Wankworth really is a rotter.  I privately suspect he is a Bcasher.  I always thought there was something a bit swivel-eyed about him.

p.s.  Lady Fuckton is charming though, and by all accounts lives up to her name.

p.p.s.  We had that computer wizz, Dr Wright, up from the village the other day to repair our laptop.  What a bore. He told us 'the electricity was going the wrong way through it' and wandered around my study in a pompous manner.  Not much help.  I'll get Mithins to take it to the experts at Walmart instead.

Cheerio Bitcoiners :)

^(Edit: names changed for legal reasons.)

e9gb5zh.Author: [deleted]
e9gb5zh.Text:
Segwit is going back up. Always remember why bitcoin stayed at 1mb block: So everyone can run a node and Bitcoin can stay decentralized. 

They are just trying to sell mining equipment which is why they keep increasing block sizes in other cryptocurrency that I won’t mention. The bigger the blocks and more power the miners have, the more it turns into fiat money; and NOT the decentralized, censorship resistant currency the world needs. Support Segwit. It’s been well over a year. Get your game together. 

Lightning needs to up its game. 

https://transactionfee.info/charts/payments/segwit

e9etfqu.Author: xelephonte
e9etfqu.Text: LOL at all the price predictions this year. Both Mark Yusko and Anthony Pompliano still believe Bitcoin will hit $25K by year’s end and $50K by 2019. Their price predictions are based on nothing but FOMO. And don’t even get me started with Tom Lee who is the biggest nut. Cryptogrip thinks Bitcoin will hit $1 million this year once Bakkt gets released...any minute now lol. I’ve been accurate all year and Bitcoin will not touch 5 digits again this year and will hit $4800 early 2019. These yuppies who think Bitcoin will make a bull run out of thin air very soon...don’t know anything. I’m not FOMO or FUD but we are in a year long drought combined with an upcoming economic recession that we’re due for. The signs are not very good in investing in ANYTHING for the next 15 months (Bitcoin, stocks, bonds, etc).

e9gbchg.Text: Because price follows interest and interest is flat for months now, and that's why the price doesn't move. "But but that's not true, you're full of shit". O yeah? That's why i predicted the price to fall back between 6200-6400 when everyone was screaming moon two weeks ago and when everyone said it's going to fall back to 5000 6 weeks ago. e9gkoj9.Author: [deleted]
e9gkoj9.Text:
Bitcoin is going on 10 years old. Tyler Cowen is right that now is the time that Bitcoin has to demonstrate its value. Last year’s fee crisis can’t be repeated. Segwit than Lightning need to be up to task. 

The next generation we are all counting on for adoption is ready to give it another chance. Don’t let them turn to the easy route of centralized Bcash. Everyone, up your game. Don’t support wallets that do not have Segwit. Advance Lightning. Now is the time. 

Bitcoin won’t get many more opportunities to demonstrate itself if we keep letting them not adopt the innovation that is already readily available. 

https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.ccn.com/economist-its-time-for-bitcoin-to-put-up-or-shut-up/amp/

e9ftbil.Author: BCash_BeTrash
e9ftbil.Text:
That is just stupid, and completely baseless.

Do you think posters like me don't get posts removed too?

It is called moderation.

And as for this 'conspiracy' that Bitcoiners like myself hate Bcash - well, of course we do!   Give me a good reason not to.  

Bcash has expended 90% of its fruitless energy and limited talents attacking Bitcoin; a coin without which you would be nothing.  So no conspiracy there I'm afraid. 

I honestly hope your shitty lying coin dies multiple deaths and fragments through the stupidity and mendacity of your corrupt leadership.

Sorry, got to go, Nursey is crossing the moonlit lawn and I could take a shot at her with my eight gun if I'm quick enough.  She has no concept of camouflage.  In her hospital white linen she is like a vast wobbly iceberg drifting on a calm sea.

^(Edit: yep)

e9gddvm.Author: aaj094
e9gddvm.Text:
If your 'price follows interest' theory was strictly true then price should be rather stable and gently changing for most of bitcoins history right? After all, if interest is the causative factor and not the other way round then one must also accept that interest is not something that will keep shifting up and down heavily. So then why do we see huge peaks and valleys in the historical price trajectory? Please explain what causes interest to go up and down in this volatile manner?

The logical answer is that price and interest feed off each other but you seem to be adamant that price follows interest.
